results.title: Erosion
results.creator_credit: Soil Conservation Service and United States. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This film relates the story of man-made erosion, showing what it has done to the earth’s productive lands. Sheet and gully erosion by water and sheet erosion by wind and their destructive effects are graphically illustrated. Conservation farming methods can overcome both man-made and natural erosion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Soil Conservation Service and United States. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Eradicate the enemy
results.creator_credit: Mushir Ahmad, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Advocates the popularising of the BCG vaccine to fight tuberculosis. BCG or Bacillus Calmette Guerin was developed at the Pasteur Institute in Paris after many years of research. It was first tested on human beings in 1921 and proved an inexpensive, speedy and effective method for the prevention and eradication of tuberculosis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mushir Ahmad, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Equality. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Art Ciocco, Paul Buck, Ken Stein, Best Films and New Jersey Public Television
results.brief_description: Explores the diversity of people and the breadth of the problems as one searches for “equality”. Concentrates on two basic areas, sex and race. Contains some b&w sequences.

results.title: Epstein
results.creator_credit: Henry Cooper, Alan Harper and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: A record of the Memorial Exhibition held in Edinburgh in 1961 of the work of Sir Jacob Epstein. Traces the development of his work and shows many of his well-known pieces - portraits of his family, of children, of many public figures, as well as his powerful symbolic figures including Lucifer, the forerunner to his St Michael on Coventry Cathedral.

results.title: Eppalock: the first six months
results.creator_credit: Department of Agriculture and Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Soil Conservation Authority’s first six months work on the big Eppalock catchment project, in which the Authority is cooperating with government departments, landholders and local councils to apply soil conservation measures to the whole of an 800 square mile catchment to ensure that only pure silt free water reaches the Eppalock Reservoir.

results.title: Episode 2 [Magnetic soundtrack]
results.creator_credit: Ray Twitchin and Bulmersche College of Education
results.brief_description: An example of student film-making: a night-marish dream of events amid much statuary, with passing references to Bunuel and Cocteau. No dialogue.

results.title: Epileptic seizure patterns
results.brief_description: A brief outline of the historic ideas about epilepsy and a description of modern methods of diagnosis, showing patients undergoing seizures of varying degrees of intensity, during which psychological changes are observed. The convulsions are correlated with an EEG graph.
results.description: A brief outline of the historic ideas about epilepsy and a description of modern methods of diagnosis, showing patients undergoing seizures of varying degrees of intensity, during which psychological changes are observed. The convulsions are correlated with an EEG graph.

results.title: Epilepsy: a label for life
results.brief_description: Epilepsy arouses feelings of prejudice and fear amongst members of the community, mainly based on ignorance. Discussed are the types of epilepsy, and use of drugs in treatment. The film also deals with the social and employment problems encountered by epileptics.

results.title: Epaves
results.brief_description: Shows the underwater life that is discovered during a trip 130 feet below the surface of the sea when exploring shipwrecks near Toulon in the Mediterranean sea. Two deep-sea divers, equipped with special cameras and other equipment, record the lively activity that takes place among the fish and undersea flora and fauna as the men inspect the shipwrecks.

results.title: Environmental awareness
results.brief_description: This film is a series of finger paintings which demonstrate how the countryside and people are affected by the growth of industry and its consequential pollution. Without words, the film uses music to express mood changes, highlighting environmental situations that emphasise the immediacy of environmental problems today.
